feed.title: sitespeed.io release feed
feed.subtitle: Follow new releases of sitespeed.io tools
feed.rights: All rights reserved 2021, Peter Hedenskog and team

entry.title: sitespeed.io 17.10.0
entry.summary: The Docker containers now contains Firefox 89 again. It seems like there's something with 90 that increase First Visual Change, especially when running in Docker. See https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T286761 and https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1720843.

entry.title: browsertime 12.11.0
entry.summary: Added screen size for Moto G4 when you run Chrome as emulated mobile #1608. Added Firefox 90 in the Docker container #1609. Fixed so we support JavaScript that ends with a ; when you select an element for for clicking #1610. See #1606 and thank you Vicky Ledsom for reporting. Fixed recording videos on new Mac M1 for emulated mobile. We used to have a hack for getting the right DPI but it seems like that didn't work on Mac M1 (depending on what screen you are using) #1607.

entry.title: coach-core 6.4.2
entry.summary: Make sure JQuery refs are set back to original ref #62 see #61.

entry.title: throttle 2.1.1
entry.summary: A better check for missing net-tools on Linux, thank you Radu Micu for the PR #56.

entry.title: coach 6.0.0
entry.summary: Use Browsertime 11.0.0 Use Coach-code 6.0 Use latest Firefox and Chrome

entry.title: chrome-trace 0.2.2
entry.summary: Catch if we can't find the first thread event. We now throws an exception (that's not optimal since we don't know what's wrong) with the info of what's wrong. We can change that later on.

entry.title: compare 1.0.0
entry.summary: Added support for using Github gists see #34. Added support for using a config file to configure which HARs to test. Added support for copy/paste directly you HAR, configuration file or a gist URL or id. Refactor the CSS into Sass, development build process now uses BrowserSync. Service worker added for offline support. Workbox is used to achieve this. Added support for showing changes in request/responses if you compare the same page #63.
